description: Rishi Sunak’s government is preparing to get the first deportation flights to Rwanda off the ground by July after the UK prime minister’s flagship law to declare the African nation a “safe” destination for asylum seekers cleared its final hurdle in Parliament.
title: Sunak’s Rwanda Deportation Bill to Become Law After Long Fight

description: For the students, it was the ultimate betrayal: Their university had called in the cops to arrest them for what they believed was a righteous protest on campus.
title: Columbia, Yale Get Tough on Protests as Students Refuse to Back Down

description: Legislation pushing Joe Biden to ratchet up sanctions on Iranian crude oil is on track to become law as soon as this week. But don’t expect the president to fully use his new powers any time soon.
title: Oil Market Sees Iran Sanctions Having Muted Impact on Exports

description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been predicting his Bharatiya Janata Party-led coalition can sweep three out of every four parliament seats as he criss-crosses the country to charm voters. Analysts and election strategists from his party say the task isn’t entirely impossible, but will likely be difficult.
title: Modi’s Path to a 400-Seat Goal Runs Through India’s South, East

description: The US is examining allegations of human rights and international law violations in Gaza — by both Israel and Hamas — and will not apply a double standard, Secretary of State Antony Blinken told reporters in Washington on Monday.
title: Blinken Denies US Human Rights ‘Double Standard’ for Israel

description: The UK will send more Storm Shadow long-range missiles to Ukraine as part of its single biggest military aid package to the country since Russia’s invasion, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said.
title: UK Sends Ukraine More Long-Range Missiles in Biggest Aid Package

description: Petroleos Mexicano’s debt refinancing should go hand-in-hand with a plan for the state oil company to venture into new kinds of energy projects and boost certainty about the state oil firm’s future, said presidential candidate Claudia Sheinbaum.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Says Her Pemex Debt Refinancing Plan Includes New Ventures

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Seattle Bureau Chief Anna Edgerton looks at how legislation intended to force ByteDance to divest itself of TikTok also takes aim at brokers selling American’ data overseas. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Cutting the Data Spigot Overseas Goes Beyond TikTok

description: Newfound unity within Venezuela’s opposition is testing President Nicolás Maduro’s willingness to risk international legitimacy or take his chances in an open presidential election.
title: Maduro Is at Crossroads as Venezuela’s Opposition Joins Together

description: Presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump sought to blame President Joe Biden for legislation that would force the sale of social media platform TikTok, even though he attempted to ban the company himself when in office.
title: Seeking Youth Vote, Trump Tries to Blame Biden for TikTok Bill

description: Chile recorded a 6% reduction in homicides in 2023 following a surge the year prior, giving President Gabriel Boric’s administration much-needed respite in its struggle against crime.
title: Chile Murders Fall as President Boric Works to Get Upper Hand on Crime

description: On today’s episode of The Big Take, rising tensions in the South China Sea over who controls the rich energy reserves within the waterway.
title: Tensions Are Growing in the South China Sea

description: Donald Trump’s lawyer launched his criminal defense at the historic trial by attempting to discredit key witnesses and arguing prosecutors have falsely accused the former president of corrupting the 2016 election by paying porn star Stormy Daniels to bury her claims of a sexual liaison.
title: Trump Lawyer Opens Hush-Money Defense Attacking Cohen, Daniels

description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador downplayed a weekend incident where his party’s candidate was stopped on a highway by masked men, and accused media and civil organizations for exaggerating violence during the electoral period.
title: Mexico’s AMLO Downplays Violence After Candidate’s Highway Holdup

description: US President Joe Biden told his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy that his administration would move quickly to distribute security assistance if the Senate votes this week to approve an aid package including $61 billion for Kyiv.
title: Biden Tells Zelenskiy Ukraine Aid Will Flow Quickly Once Senate Votes

description: Snap Inc. is leaning in on covering the US elections, tapping into its deep user base of eligible voters even as larger rival Meta Platforms Inc. downplays political content prominence on its social media sites.
title: Snap Leans Into Election Coverage in Bid for Political Ads

description: Israel has yet to provide evidence that workers for the United Nations relief agency in the Gaza Strip have widespread ties to terrorist groups, according to the results of an external probe.
title: Israel Yet to Offer Proof UN Staff in Gaza Have Ties to Hamas

description: The UK is still exporting fewer goods than before Brexit, as the economy becomes more reliant on selling services to the rest of the world, according to official data.
title: UK Exports Fewer Goods After Brexit, Tilting Economy to Services

description: From prison to the presidency, Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has turned to one ally more than any other in moments of need: Fernando Haddad, the once and potentially future political heir he named his finance minister.
title: Brazil’s Fiscal Woes Ramp Up Pressure on Lula’s Finance Chief

description: The European Central Bank can’t be the solution to the funding challenges for the green transition as it’s legally impossible and would risk stoking inflation, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.
title: ECB’s Villeroy Says Green QE Neither Desirable, Nor Possible

description: TikTok’s future in the US is heading toward its moment of truth.
title: What a TikTok Ban in the US Would Mean for the App

description: Lawmakers in Oklahoma are having second thoughts about anti-ESG legislation that limits which Wall Street banks local governments can do business with.
title: Republicans Weigh Rolling Back Anti-ESG Law They Passed

description: The UK has developed a controversial solution to the migration pressures facing many developed nations: Send asylum-seekers to Africa. The plan — first floated by then-Prime Minister Boris Johnson in April 2022 — was to immediately deport migrants who arrive on British shores without permission some 4,000 miles (6,440 kilometers) to Rwanda and leave them there. Two years later, the UK has yet to fly a single migrant to the central African nation, having been rejected in a string of legal defeats
title: Why the UK’s Plan to Stop Migrants Depends on Rwanda

description: Taxpayer contributions to New York City and state pensions will rise by $4 billion under a benefit sweetener for some public employees included in the state budget.
title: NY Budget Sweetens Pensions for Some Workers at $4 Billion Cost

description: Israel is returning its focus to eliminating what it says is the last remaining stronghold of Hamas in Gaza — reviving international concerns about the fate of about one million civilians sheltering in the south of the strip.
title: Israel Turns Focus Back to Hamas and Rafah as Iran Threat Eases

description: Ecuadorian bonds led gains among emerging-market sovereign peers Monday as traders cheered President Daniel Noboa’s strong showing in Sunday’s referendum.
title: Wall Street Cheers Ecuador Noboa’s Referendum Win

description: Norwegian parties are considering a “significant” increase to the country’s 75 billion-krone ($6.8 billion) long-term aid for Ukraine, according to Foreign Minister Espen Barth Eide.
title: Norway Parties Considering ‘Significant’ Boost to Ukraine Aid

description: Tensions between President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration and Brazil’s Congress are threatening to deal significant setbacks to the government’s efforts to shore up public accounts.
title: Crisis in Brazil’s Congress Gives Lula $18.5 Billion in New Fiscal Headaches

description: The Supreme Court’s historic consideration of Donald Trump’s claim of immunity from criminal charges for trying to overturn the 2020 election is running up against a stark reality: The calendar is as important as the Constitution.
title: Trump’s Immunity Gambit at Supreme Court: A Delay Is Still a Victory

description: South Africa’s president and head of the ruling African National Congress, Cyril Ramaphosa pledged to end “health-care apartheid” with a controversial bill that awaits his sign-off.
title: Ramaphosa Vows to End ‘Health-Care Apartheid’ With Prickly Law

description: The US Supreme Court let one of billionaire Stephen Ross’ companies press ahead with a lawsuit that accuses two soccer governing bodies of illegally thwarting his efforts to stage regular-season matches in the US between foreign teams.
title: FIFA, US Soccer Spurned by High Court on Billionaire Ross’ Suit

description: The US Supreme Court agreed to decide whether President Joe Biden’s administration can regulate build-at-home “ghost gun” kits, adding to a growing list of firearms cases on the high court’s agenda.
title: Supreme Court Will Review Biden Administration ‘Ghost Gun’ Rule

description: Donald Trump attends jury selection for his trial at Manhattan Criminal Court in New York City on April 19. Photographer: Spencer Platt/AFP
title: Opening Arguments Start in Trump Hush-Money Case

description: The UK charged two men under the Official Secrets Act over allegations they spied for China after an “extremely complex” counter-terror investigation.
title: UK Charges Two Men Over China Spying Allegations

description: Canadians are starting to question whether their jobs are still safe.
title: Perceived Job Security in Canada Falls to Lowest Since Covid

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Urban Apathy May Worsen Voter Turnout in Tech-Hub Bengaluru: India Votes

description: Russia and China have almost completely stopped using the dollar in their mutual trade, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said in Moscow on Monday, according to Tass.
title: Lavrov Says Russia, China Almost Dedollarized Their Trade: Tass

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The West Calls Putin’s Bet on Waning Support for Ukraine

description: Rishi Sunak said the first deportation flights will leave for Rwanda within 12 weeks, as the British prime minister sought to finally pass legislation this week to allow his flagship migration policy to go ahead.
title: Sunak Says First Rwanda Deportation Flights to Leave by July

description: German authorities arrested two men and a woman suspected of working for China’s ministry of state security to acquire details of ship-engine technology and buy a special laser on its behalf without export authorization.
title: Germany Arrests Three Suspected of Spying for Chinese State

description: Ukraine’s hard-currency bonds crept higher on Monday, as investors digested the approval of a $61 billion aid package by the US House of Representatives over the weekend.
title: Ukraine Bonds Edge Higher as Caution Prevails on US Support

description: The US is unlikely to strongly enforce sanctions on Iran and risk sending oil prices higher in an election year, consultant Energy Aspects Ltd. said, even after the House set new restrictions in motion against the country’s energy sector.
title: US Unlikely to Enforce Iran Sanctions in Election Year: Analyst

description: The Israeli military said the head of its intelligence division quit over the failure to prevent the Oct. 7 invasion by Hamas, an attack that left about 1,200 dead and triggered the ongoing war in Gaza.
title: Israeli Military Intelligence Chief Resigns Over Oct. 7 Failure

description: A South African court rejected a bid by the ruling African National Congress to stop a party backed by former President Jacob Zuma from using its name and logo.
title: South Africa’s ANC Loses Court Battle With Zuma Over Trademark

description: European Union foreign and defense ministers are poised to reach a political agreement on Monday to impose new sanctions on Iran over its attack on Israel.
title: EU Is Set to Impose Iran Sanctions for Missile Attacks on Israel

description: Egypt expects to get $400 million in budget support from the UK over two years, the latest component of a vast global bailout for the North African country’s economy.
title: Egypt to Get UK Budget Support to Top Off $57 Billion Global Aid

description: Indonesia’s Constitutional Court has ruled against a challenge filed by one of Prabowo Subianto’s rivals, clearing his path to becoming the country’s next president.
title: Indonesia Court Dismisses Appeal Against Prabowo’s Election Win

description: China’s top diplomat has pledged to further boost security ties with Cambodia during a visit amid concerns over the extended presence of its warships at a naval base on the Gulf of Thailand.
title: Chinese Warships in Cambodia Fuel Fresh Concerns as Wang Visits

description: Israeli air strikes overnight killed 24 Palestinians in the southern Gazan city of Rafah, the Hamas-run Health Ministry said.
title: Israeli Air Strikes Kill 24 in Rafah, Gaza Health Officials Say

description: Maldives’ ruling People’s National Congress party won an absolute majority in parliament in elections held Sunday, giving President Mohamed Muizzu’s pro-China policies a boost.
title: Maldives’ Pro-China President Secures Majority in Parliament

description: Vietnam police detained the assistant to the head of the National Assembly over a probe into a builder, amid a widening anti-graft drive in the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Vietnam Detains Parliament Chair’s Assistant as Builder Probed

description: South Africa is playing all sides when it comes to foreign policy as the country seeks to position itself as a leading voice of the Global South, and the approach seems to be working — so far.
title: South Africa Evades US Censure Even as It Builds Links to Rivals

description: India’s election agency is re-holding polls at 11 locations in the conflict-hit Manipur state on Monday after reports of gunfire and destruction of electoral machines during voting last week.
title: India Repeats Voting at Some Manipur Locations Hit by Violence

description: Outsider CEOs and entrepreneurs are shaking up the Paris billionaires’ club.
title: Macron's Very Un-French Business Revolution

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol named a new chief of staff Monday after pledging to change his approach following a stinging loss for his conservative party in parliamentary elections earlier this month.
title: South Korea’s Yoon Starts Reshaping Team After Election Defeat

description: Ecuador’s voters approved a raft of security measures including extradition for drug traffickers, while rejecting investor-friendly economic reforms, handing a partial victory to President Daniel Noboa in Sunday’s referendum.
title: Ecuador Voters Back Noboa’s Anti-Mafia Measures, But Reject His Economic Reforms

description: A high-profile trip to meet Joe Biden in Washington failed to provide a substantial poll boost for Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, fueling doubts over whether his ruling party can eke out a special election victory that could be key to his longevity as leader.
title: Japan’s Kishida Struggles in Polls Ahead of Special Elections

description: Australia is gearing up for a fight with Elon Musk and American social media giants over allegations they failed to move fast enough to police graphic content and misinformation during two violent attacks in Sydney over the past 10 days.
title: Musk Draws Australia’s Wrath Over Sydney Attack Images on X

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is struggling to build support for his government one year out from a likely election, even as it received strong backing for a new industry policy to bolster domestic green energy and high-tech manufacturing.
title: Australian PM’s Poll Struggles Persist Even After Industry Push

description: Canada is on the verge of an agreement with Honda Motor Co. that would see the Japanese firm build electric vehicles and their components in the province of Ontario, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Honda Nears Deal With Canada to Boost Electric Vehicle Capacity

description: After years of working to assure the US government that its popular social media app isn’t a threat to national security, TikTok’s loss in that fight now seems almost inevitable.
title: TikTok Braces for US Divest-or-Ban Law — And a Fresh Legal Fight
